LanguageData.Hay.label: hay
LanguageData.Hay.description: Nutrient-rich grasses and shoots, harvested and compacted for storage. Hay is good animal feed, but inedible for humans.
LanguageData.RawHops.label: hops
LanguageData.RawHops.description: Raw hops. A flavoring and preserving agent that is necessary for making beer.
LanguageData.RawPotatoes.label: potatoes
LanguageData.RawCorn.label: corn
LanguageData.RawCorn.description: Raw corn. Nice to eat, even when raw.
LanguageData.RawRice.label: rice
LanguageData.RawBerries.label: berries
LanguageData.RawBerries.description: Assorted berries. Nice to eat, even when raw.
LanguageData.RawAgave.label: agave fruit
LanguageData.Milk.label: milk
LanguageData.EggChickenUnfertilized.label: chicken egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.EggChickenUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized chicken egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.
LanguageData.EggChickenFertilized.label: chicken egg (fert.)
LanguageData.EggChickenFertilized.description: Fertilized chicken egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a chick. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.EggCobraFertilized.label: cobra egg (fert.)
LanguageData.EggCobraFertilized.description: Fertilized cobra egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby cobra. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.EggIguanaFertilized.label: iguana egg (fert.)
LanguageData.EggIguanaFertilized.description: Fertilized iguana egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby iguana. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.EggTortoiseFertilized.label: tortoise egg (fert.)
LanguageData.EggTortoiseFertilized.description: Fertilized tortoise egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby tortoise. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
